subject: Career
title: Negotiating Your First Raise
description: A micro-lesson that makes Negotiating Your First Raise usable.

hook.text: You've been in the role for a year. You deserve a raise. But how do you ask without sounding greedy?

buildup.text: Raise negotiations require preparation: document your wins, research market rates, and choose your timing.

discovery.text: The best time to negotiate a raise is after a visible win â€” a completed project, positive review, or new responsibility.

twist.text: Most managers expect raise requests. It's not confrontational â€” it's professional. Not asking is the bigger mistake.

climax.text: Lead with value: 'Here's what I've contributed. Here's the market rate. I'd like to discuss alignment.'

punchline.text: Asking for a raise isn't greedy. Not knowing your value is costly.

quiz.question: When is the best time to negotiate a raise?
options: After a visible win like a completed project or positive review
